definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly

sentences.english: To tell you the truth, I did not like her. I thought she was too much enchanting.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，起初我並不喜歡她，感覺她太妖嬈了。

sentences.english: I do not like to boast of my own child, but to be sure, Jane -- one does not often see any body better looking.
sentences.chinese: 我並不喜歡誇張自己的孩子，可是說老實話。

sentences.english: To tell you the truth, when I have trouble, I always ask her for advice.
sentences.chinese: 跟你說老實話，每當我有麻煩時總向她徵求意見。

sentences.english: She would rather tell the truth than lie.
sentences.chinese: 她寧願講實話而不願說謊。

sentences.english: So, why not speak the truth?
sentences.chinese: 既然如此，爲什麼不說實話呢？

sentences.english: To be honest, Rumei, I don't like the colour orange.
sentences.chinese: 說句實話，我不喜歡橘黃色。

sentences.english: Honestly, the rate of commi ion you are going to grant us is far too small.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，你方給我們的導航已取消怎麼辦佣金太少了。

sentences.english: Honestly, I don’t often think about the state of ‘emo’.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，我不常思考‘emo’的狀況。

sentences.english: To tell you the truth, I can cooperate with various people .
sentences.chinese: 道實話，我能戰林林總總的人協作。

sentences.english: Next best thing to tell the truth, ' muttered Captain Smollett. 'Load his gun, Hawkins.
sentences.chinese: “講實話也算不錯，”斯莫列特船長咕噥道。
“那麼最好跟他們說實話，”吉夫說。

sentences.english: To be honest I needed to check the spelling first.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，我得先看看自己有沒有拼對詞。

sentences.english: It is as I tell you.
To tell you the truth, dad, I never drink spirit even if I am from the northeast.
sentences.chinese: 爹地，說老實話，雖然是東北人，可我從來不喝白酒。

sentences.english: If he said that，he can’t be telling the truth.
sentences.chinese: 如果他說了那樣的話，他不可能是說實話。

sentences.english: I think she is not afraid to speak out.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲她不害怕實話實說。

definition: to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
upstairs/(Internet slang) previous poster in a forum thread
